author: Shiv Sunny
text:
At a time when the Delhi police face criticism over their handling of the JNU row, senior IPS officer Alok Kumar Verma on Monday took over the reins of the force, promising to follow an “open door policy”.

Taking to Twitter to provide an insight into his style of functioning, Mr. Verma promised “an easy access to me and my team at the PHQ (police headquarters) without any entry or parking hassles”.

Mr. Verma, a 1979-batch AGMUT cadre official, took over as the Delhi Police Commissioner from BS Bassi who retired upon completion of his service on Monday. The day also coincided with the retirement of another IPS officer, Vimla Mehra, as the Special CP (General Administration).

Mr. Bassi remained his defiant self even on his last day in office, maintaining that he had no “regrets” about his tenure. “When you are happy and satisfied, and you know that you have done whatever you could from your end, then there is no question of regret,” said Mr. Bassi.
title: Bassi exits, Alok Kumar Verma is Delhi Police Commissioner
